body: @okwme lemme know if this needs any changes! thanks!

Hi @wuehler yes it's working for me, i just deployed a new contract, added and then withdrew funds.

Do you have metamask installed and is the wallet unlocked? We haven't added any fallback dialog yet, so without those you only see a loading screen upon landing.

Can you tell us more what doesn't seem to be working?
Yes, I have metamask (have been using it a long time).. when I try to deploy the popup says to unlock the wallet.. but my wallet is unlocked.
hmm, that's strange. i don't know why it might affect it but can you tell me which browser and network you're using?

Chrome, mainnet

On Tue, Oct 24, 2017 at 3:41 PM, billy <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> hmm, that's strange. i don't know why it might affect it but can you tell
> me which browser and network you're using?
>

I just locked, unlocked metamask. Then refreshed the page. Still says to unlock wallet. You'll get lots of attention to the site on Friday so hoping to help troubleshoot this ;)
@wuehler i've just deployed a debugger that prints wallet info, can you hard refresh and let me know what you see (thanks for the heads up btw!)
@wuehler oof i found it, we weren't whitelisting mainnet network id. THANK YOU FOR NOTICING!!!
@wuehler thank you!! Appreciate the testing!
working now, noticing that gas price estimates for mainnet are really low tho, transactions didn't go through in 50 blocks and failed, closing this and making a new issue to increase gas price
not sure if this is working with every action
Yeah it had metamask suggesting 20 Gwei.. i was able to put it through at 1 Gwei. Look into how you are estimating gas... Also, what are you using for your fiat price api?

oh really? i got a 50 block timeout at 10 Gwei, suggestion was 1 Gwei.
Those are coming from metamask directly though, if i used web3 to make the
predictions myself it would be the same mechanism as metamask, wouldn't it?
would you recommend another method for gas estimate and gas price estimate?
We're using cryptocompare's api for the fiat price, are you seeing sth
inaccurate? seems to be ~$1 off from coincap and almost same as coinbase.

INFURA has a fiat/crypto api: http://docs.infura.apiary.io/

Could gain points using and mentioning it on Friday ;)
regarding gas estimates, not sure.. will have to look into that

aha thanks for the tip!
would be cool if yall offered multiple currency rates in a single call though 😬
I'll pass that feedback on
moving to issue #44
confirmed with allocate share

confirmed with deposit
confirmed withdraw
@okwme we'd have to think about a good solution, since metamask is mostly desktop. Unless we can get to metamascara, we'd need to just show info only

Tru, just thinking about what audience members would see if they visited
during presentation. I tried using a mobile meta header and things got
wonky real quick, maybe better to leave as is now where mobile is just
zoomed in/out version of desktop

NOTE: This ticket is now changing to be the following:
Setup mobile Web3 resource for reading from mainnet. This will allow users on mobile to see data without external helpers (MetaMask, etc)

NOTE: Previously titled "contract not found error"

Setup messaging for if contract cannot be found, or is on different network.

Another idea:
Use localstorage to store contract address & network used. This way we could potentially alert the user of past contracts and link.
new branch develop

Hi @davidp94 thanks for taking a look at the code! That's an old test version of the contract and you're quite right those are unused vars. In the live version of the contracts (originally available at https://github.com/defactoknife/doneth-truffle but currently being merged into this repo) they were also properly labeled as unused. 

They were intended for a possible future version of the contract which incremented new shares to project members on a recurring time scale. This would ensure something like eventual equality based on time associated with the project. At this point I think we will consider it out of scope so should probably remove them, thank you for pointing them out again. And thanks for looking through the code in general! We welcome you to make new issues on anything else you may find : )
progress on branch tmp-contract
